title: Sam Smith twerks on Brooklyn Bridge with friends and it’s a mood
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Sam Smith is having a great time in New York City, if their twerking antics are anything to go by, and it comes after they revealed that they are non-binary.

The 27-year-old singer took to Instagram to show off their dancing skills and twerked on Brooklyn Bridge with their friends after taking to the streets and having a cheeky wiggle for New Yorkers.

Dressed in a button-down shirt, Sam jumped on the side of the Brooklyn bridge and let loose the twerk, before bouncing off and dramatically fanning themselves.

Another video sees them dancing in the street, resplendent in a fringe jean jacket – because fringe is obviously making a comeback.

Sam Smith is busting those moves on the bridge and we are here for it (Picture: Sam Smith/ Instagram)

Sam uploaded photos and videos of their day, and in they have on thick black eyeliner and a white sleeveless top as they dance in a packed club, and in another they’re clinking glasses with a fellow party goer.

The tattoo Sam recently got of their idols Marlon Brando and James Dean kissing was visible on their arm.

They gave the photos a simple caption: ‘I love my friends’.

Last month the Stay With Me singer revealed that they are officially using ‘they’ and ‘them’ pronounces to describe their gender non-binary identity.

Sam’s mates looked they were enjoying themselves with the singer (Picture: Sam Smith/Instagram)

Smith posted a photo with the words ‘My pronouns are they/they’.

They continued: ‘Today is a good day so here goes. I’ve decided I am changing my pronouns to THEY/THEM’.

They went on to say that following a ‘lifetime of being at war’ with their gender, they have decided to ‘embrace myself for who I am, inside and out’.

The singer has elicited much support for coming out as non-binary, and friend Munroe Bergdorf told Metro.co.uk that they were ‘brave’.

Munroe, who is part of the transgender community, said: ‘It’s such an amazing, brave move for someone who is as successful and well known as them to come out and say, “you know what, this is how I want to be referred to, and that has such huge implications for the non binary community as well’.

Days after their announcement, the Brit Awards announced that they are still keeping their male and female categories for their 2020 show after claims they would be removing the gendered nominations to accommodate non-binary artists such as Smith.

A music industry source told The Sun: ‘Bosses are listening to changes happening in the industry. The categories will evolve in the coming years.

‘The male and female categories will still be in place next February but changes are being planned for the following year.

‘Organisers will be consulting labels and artists alike to work out what is best for the future of the Brits ceremony.’
